modules.description: Provides functions for capturing and injecting raw Ethernet frames, with support for BPF and AF_PACKET backends. Operates on byte sequences and Ethernet headers, enabling low-level network interaction. Used for tasks like crafting custom link-layer packets or implementing protocol-specific sniffing logic.

Provides functions to open, read from, and write to raw network interfaces using either BPF or AF_SOCKET backends. Operates on interface names and Cstruct.t buffers to handle full Ethernet frames. Used for capturing or injecting packets with specific filters, such as DHCP traffic on ports 67 and 68.

The module enables direct manipulation of BPF header fields within `Cstruct.t` buffers, including timestamp and length operations, along with data alignment and socket setup for raw packet handling. It supports byte-level transformations of `Cstruct` data into lists, facilitating packet segmentation and protocol-specific data processing. These capabilities are essential for network monitoring, packet analysis, and custom data parsing workflows.
